PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The highest exciton dissociation of the PffBB-14 - based device is anticipated to give rise to the best photovoltaic performance among these series of polymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| highest exciton dissociation |
| best photovoltaic performance |

The two entities identified as "Property Name" are "highest exciton dissociation" and "best photovoltaic performance". These are properties that can be attributed to a device or material, and are mentioned in the context of being associated with the PffBB-14 based device.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| highest exciton dissociation |

After reviewing the previous answer, I realized that only one entity, "highest exciton dissociation", clearly refers to a material property. The other entity, "best photovoltaic performance", is a desirable outcome that can be achieved through the optimization of material properties, but it is not a property itself. Therefore, I have removed it from the list.

Exciton dissociation is a material property that describes the ability of a material to separate excitons (bound electron-hole pairs) into free charge carriers, which is an important process in photovoltaic devices.
